page.title: 03CLUBS (2)
page.content: THE DANCING SCHOOL HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE SINCE 1978. BALLET, TAP AND MODERN DANCING ARE TAUGHT BY 2 TEACHERS TO ABOUT 160 PUPILS. BALLET IS THE MOST POPULAR AND EACH YEAR THE PUPILS PERFORM A CONCERT. FOR THE LAST 4 YEARS KARATE HAS BEEN TAUGHT AT SOMERSHAM. IT IS A TECHNIQUE OF SELF DEFENCE WITHOUT THE USE OF WEAPONS, BUT IT ALSO TEACHES DISCIPLINE, CONFIDENCE AND SELF CONTROL OVER MIND AND BODY. BROWNIES IS HELD EVERY TUESDAY AND FRIDAY FOR GIRLS FROM THE AGE OF 7 TO 11. AT THE AGE OF 10 THE GIRLS MAY MOVE ON TO THE GUIDES WHICH IS HELD EVERY FRIDAY FROM 7.15 TO 9.00. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INDOOR AND OUTDOOR GAMES, LOCAL WALKS, NATURE STUDIES AND BADGE WORK. WORK FOR THE BADGES COVERS ACTIVITIES SUCH AS FIRST AID, SWIMMING, DANCING, TOY MAKING, (CONT.)
